intro: Lupinus bingenensis var. albus, commonly known as the white lupine, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its upright growth habit and compound leaves. The plant produces erect, sparsely branched stems with clusters of white to pale yellow flowers. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and are often used in agricultural settings for forage or soil enrichment. The white lupine is also valued for its nitrogen-fixing ability, which benefits soil fertility.
